title: Grindavík men's football
text:
The Grindavík men's football team is the men's <a href="Association%20football">football</a> department of the <a href="Ungmennaf%C3%A9lag%20Grindav%C3%ADkur">Ungmennafélag Grindavíkur</a> <a href="multi-sport%20club">multi-sport club</a>. It is based in <a href="Grindav%C3%ADk">Grindavík</a> in south-west <a href="Iceland">Iceland</a>, and currently plays in the <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild%20karla%20%28football%29">Úrvalsdeild karla</a>, the <a href="Icelandic%20football%20league%20system">top-tier men's football league in Iceland</a>.
History.
The club won its way slowly up the leagues, beginning in the third tier and spending some time there before promotion to the second tier and at last promotion to the <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild">first tier</a> in 1994. The club established itself there, and for years was the only side in the top divisions to have never been relegated from any division. <a href="Sigur%C3%B0ur%20J%C3%B3nsson%20%28footballer%29">Sigurður Jónsson</a> was appointed manager before the 2006 season, after a successful period at Víkingur. In that season, Grindavík got relegated for the first time in their history. In September 2006 with three rounds to go, Sigurður resigned as a manager and his assistants managers, <a href="Magni%20Fannberg%20Magn%C3%BAsson">Magni Fannberg Magnússon</a> and Milan Stefán Jankovic took control. They made a draw against <a href="Fimleikaf%C3%A9lag%20Hafnarfjar%C3%B0ar">Fimleikafélag Hafnarfjarðar</a>, 1:1, in the last round, but it was clear before the game that they needed to win. On September 22, 2007, Grindavík won a promotion back to the <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild">Úrvalsdeild</a> after a 6–0 win over Reynir Sandgerði, with still one round unplayed. They managed to stay in the top league from 2008 until 2012, when they were again relegated to <a href="1.%20deild%20karla%20%28football%29">1. deild</a> for the <a href="2013%201.%20deild%20karla">2013 season</a>.
In <a href="2017%20%C3%9Arvalsdeild">2017</a>, Grindavík finished 5th in the Úrvalsdeild. <a href="Andri%20R%C3%BAnar%20Bjarnason">Andri Rúnar Bjarnason</a> finished as the league's top goalscorer and was named the player of the season.
Honours.
<a href="Icelandic%20Men%27s%20Football%20League%20Cup">Icelandic League Cup</a>
